tool.name: buildDataSources

param.name: masterDataSourcesTable
param.displayname: Excel Table with Master List of DataSource Info:
param.dialogReference: A master excel table with DataSourceIDs and the corresponding references and URLs. The header names should be "FOLDERNAME" (DataSourceIDs), "AUTHORS", "SOURCEURL", and "REFERENCE".

param.name: gdb
param.dialogReference: A file geodatabase. NOTE: ASSUMES ALL FEATURE CLASSES WILL BE CONTAINED WITHIN FEATURE DATASETS - DONT INPUT THE FEATURE DATASET, BUT THE GEODATABASE THAT CONTAINS IT

param.name: exampleBlankDataSourceTable
param.dialogReference: A correctly formatted "blank" DataSources table. Note: We created this using the GeMS "Create New Database" tool, which adds a single entry to the table of FGDC-STD-013-2006. The code assumes this will be present in the otherwise blank table. Leave this blank if you want the entries added to an already partially populated table; it must be properly formated.

param.name: onlyTables
param.displayname: Only Build Based on Non-Spatial Tables
param.dialogReference: If this option is selected the tool will only look for DataSourceIDs in the non-spatial tables in the database. All feature classes will be ignored. If not selected no tables will be looked at only all the feature classes contained within any feature datasets. Run the tool twice if you want both feature classes and tables to be considered.

tool.summary: This tool builds a DataSources table from all the DataSourceIDs in the GDB and a master table.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool builds a DataSources table from all the DataSourceIDs in the GDB and a master table.
